001package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.quest;
002
003
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.annotation.Ring;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.assertion.CustomSoftAssertion;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.chain.FluentService;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.log.LogQuest;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.Storage;
009import java.util.HashMap;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.Optional;
013
014import static io.cyborgcode.utilities.reflections.ReflectionUtil.getFieldValues;
015
016/**
017 * Manages the execution flow and data storage for test scenarios.
018 *
019 * <p>This class acts as the central controller for executing test operations,
020 * managing service interactions, and storing data during a test run.
021 * It allows transitioning between different testing contexts (rings) and
022 * ensures test completion with proper validations.
023 *
024 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
025 */
026public class Quest {
027
028   /**
029    * Stores registered test services, mapping their types to instances.
030    */
031   private final Map<Class<? extends FluentService>, FluentService> rings = new HashMap<>();
032
033   /**
034    * Storage instance for temporarily holding test data within a test execution.
035    */
036   private final Storage storage;
037
038   /**
039    * Handles soft assertions for validation checks during the test execution.
040    */
041   private final CustomSoftAssertion softAssertions = new CustomSoftAssertion();
042
043   /**
044    * Initializes a new {@code Quest} instance with a fresh storage object.
045    */
046   public Quest() {
047      this.storage = new Storage();
048   }
049
050   /**
051    * Transitions the test execution context into the specified ring (test service).
052    *
053    * <p>This method retrieves a registered service by its class type and allows the test execution
054    * to proceed within that context.
055    *
056    * @param ring The class type of the desired test service.
057    * @param <T>  The type of the fluent service.
058    * @return The corresponding fluent service instance.
059    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the specified ring is not registered.
060    */
061   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
062   public <T extends FluentService> T use(Class<T> ring) {
063      Optional<Class<? extends FluentService>> match =
064            rings.keySet().stream().filter(ring::isAssignableFrom).findFirst();
065      if (match.isEmpty()) {
066         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ring not initialized: " + ring.getName());
067      }
068      Ring ringName = ring.getAnnotation(Ring.class);
069
070      String message = ringName == null
071            ? "The quest has used the ring: '" + ring.getName() + "'"
072            : "The quest has used the ring: '" + ringName.value() + "'";
073
074      LogQuest.info(message);
075      return (T) rings.get(match.get());
076   }
077
078   /**
079    * Retrieves a registered fluent service without modifying the execution context.
080    *
081    * @param ringType The class type of the service to retrieve.
082    * @param <T>       The type of the fluent service.
083    * @return The corresponding service instance.
084    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the specified ring is not registered.
085    */
086   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
087   protected <T extends FluentService> T cast(Class<T> ringType) {
088      Optional<Class<? extends FluentService>> match =
089            rings.keySet().stream().filter(ringType::isAssignableFrom).findFirst();
090      if (match.isEmpty()) {
091         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ring not initialized: " + ringType.getName());
092      }
093      return (T) rings.get(match.get());
094   }
095
096   /**
097    * Marks the completion of the test execution.
098    *
099    * <p>This method logs the completion, clears the test execution state, and verifies all
100    * soft assertions collected during the test execution.
101    */
102   public void complete() {
103      LogQuest.info("The quest has reached his end");
104      QuestHolder.clear();
105      softAssertions.assertAll();
106   }
107
108   /**
109    * Retrieves an artifact associated with a specific test service.
110    *
111    * <p>This method extracts an instance of the specified artifact type from the
112    * requested test service.
113    *
114    * @param ringType    The class type of the test service.
115    * @param artifactType The class type of the artifact to retrieve.
116    * @param <T>          The type of the test service.
117    * @param <K>          The type of the artifact.
118    * @return The retrieved artifact instance.
119    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If input parameters are null.
120    * @throws IllegalStateException    If the requested ring is not available.
121    */
122   protected <T extends FluentService, K> K artifact(Class<T> ringType, Class<K> artifactType) {
123      if (ringType == null || artifactType == null) {
124         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Parameters ringType and artifactType must not be null.");
125      }
126
127      T ring = cast(ringType);
128      if (ring == null) {
129         throw new IllegalStateException(
130               "Could not retrieve an instance of the specified ringType: " + ringType.getName());
131      }
132
133      List<K> fieldValues = getFieldValues(ring, artifactType);
134      if (fieldValues.size() > 1) {
135         LogQuest.warn(
136               "There is more than one artifact from type: {} inside class: {}. The first one will be taken: {}",
137               artifactType, ringType, fieldValues.get(0));
138      }
139      return fieldValues.get(0);
140   }
141
142   /**
143    * Registers a new test service into the current execution context.
144    *
145    * @param ringType The class type of the test service.
146    * @param ring     The instance of the test service.
147    */
148   protected void registerRing(Class<? extends FluentService> ringType, FluentService ring) {
149      rings.put(ringType, ring);
150   }
151
152   /**
153    * Removes a test service from the current execution context.
154    *
155    * @param ringType The class type of the test service to remove.
156    */
157   protected void removeRing(Class<? extends FluentService> ringType) {
158      rings.remove(ringType);
159   }
160
161   /**
162    * Provides access to the storage instance for managing temporary test data.
163    *
164    * @return The storage instance.
165    */
166   protected Storage getStorage() {
167      return storage;
168   }
169
170   /**
171    * Provides access to the soft assertion handler for managing test validations.
172    *
173    * @return The soft assertion handler.
174    */
175   protected CustomSoftAssertion getSoftAssertions() {
176      return softAssertions;
177   }
178
179}
180
